private_information: I can move disks A B C D E (A is smallest, E is largest within my set)
I am responsible for any primitive move that involves disks A B C D E
agent_1.goal: Contribute with legal primitive moves so that the global goal configuration is achieved

private_information: I can move disks F G H I J (F is smallest in my set, J the largest)
I am responsible for any primitive move that involves disks F G H I J
agent_2.goal: Contribute with legal primitive moves so that the global goal configuration is achieved

private_information: I can move disks K L M N O (K is smallest in my set, O the largest)
I am responsible for any primitive move that involves disks K L M N O
agent_3.goal: Contribute with legal primitive moves so that the global goal configuration is achieved

private_information: I coordinate the three agents and will produce the final PDDL domain and problem targeting FastDownwards
I will also produce a consolidated ordered list of primitive moves that respects agent restrictions and Tower of Hanoi rules
orchestrator.goal: Produce a combined plan that achieves the goal configuration and a PDDL domain and problem for FastDownwards

public_information: There are three pegs named left middle and right
There are 15 disks labeled A B C D E F G H I J K L M N O with A smallest and O largest
Initial configuration left peg from top to bottom is A B C D E F G H I J K L M N O
Goal configuration left peg top to bottom is E F G H I J K L M N O
Goal configuration middle peg top to bottom is B
Goal configuration right peg top to bottom is A C D
Tower of Hanoi rules apply: only the top disk on any peg can be moved and a larger disk cannot be placed on top of a smaller disk
Agents are restricted: agent_1 may only move disks A B C D E agent_2 may only move disks F G H I J agent_3 may only move disks K L M N O

moves.system_prompt: You are agent_1. Produce an ordered list of primitive moves that you will perform. Each move must be in the exact format 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Only include moves that move disks A B C D E. All moves must respect Tower of Hanoi rules and the public information. Do not emit PDDL. Provide the sequence that you will execute as plain lines in order.
moves.prompt: Your name is agent_1. Public information: {environment->public_information} Your private information: {agents->agent_1->private_information} Global goal: {agents->agent_1->goal} Provide an ordered list of primitive moves in the exact format 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2' that you will perform. Only include moves for disks A B C D E. Ensure each move is legal given the Tower of Hanoi rules and the current visible configuration. If you need to wait for other agents to move before a legal move is possible then indicate the waiting implicitly by simply not listing illegal moves.

Provide the sequence that you will execute as plain lines in order.

Only include moves for disks F G H I J. Ensure each move is legal given the Tower of Hanoi rules and the current visible configuration. Only include moves for disks K L M N O. Ensure each move is legal given the Tower of Hanoi rules and the current visible configuration. pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent PDDL for the FastDownwards planner. Your job is to integrate the primitive move lists from the three agents, keep each agent's actions distinct, produce a consolidated ordered list of primitive moves in the exact format 'agent_i: move disk X from peg1 to peg2', and produce a final PDDL domain and PDDL problem targeting FastDownwards. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Ensure the PDDL models the three agents and respects the Tower of Hanoi rules and agent disk movement restrictions.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Public information: {environment->public_information} Agent 1 information: {agents->agent_1->private_information} Agent 2 information: {agents->agent_2->private_information} Agent 3 information: {agents->agent_3->private_information} Here are the move lists from the agents: {moves_agent_1} {moves_agent_2} {moves_agent_3} Your tasks are: 1 Integrate and if needed reorder the primitive moves into a single legal global sequence that respects Tower of Hanoi rules and agent movement restrictions. Output that consolidated ordered list of primitive moves in the exact format 'agent_i: move disk X from peg1 to peg2' with one move per line. 2 Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem targeting the FastDownwards solver that encodes the pegs disks initial state goal state agent restrictions and legal move actions. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep agent actions distinct in the PDDL.
